detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Classes will be held at Life Sciences Centre (LSC), room 1510, from 3:30 pm to 4:50 pm. If you want to be added to MEDG 419 waitlist, please contact Dr. Catherine Van Raamsdonk, MEDG 419 Course Coordinator, at c.vr@ubc.ca for permission to be added to the waitlist.

instances.text: MEDG_V 420-001 - Human Genomics and Medical Genetics

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Location: UBC Life Sciences Centre, Room 1410 NOTE: This is an upper level Medical Genetics course requiring independent learning, class discussion and strong background in basic genetics. Students must have at least a 'B' grade in the prerequisites BIOL335 and/or BIOL338. Contact Medical Genetics Graduate Program Coordinator, Azin Zeinali, at medical.genetics@ubc.ca with a description of your background, the prerequisite gardes, or equivalnet courses if you wish to be added to the waitlist.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: The mode of delivery for this section is in-person.  In person attendance is required for all course activities, including examinations. Registration questions should be directed to Dr. Kion, tkion@mail.ubc.ca.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: The mode of delivery for this section is in-person.  In person attendance is required for all course activities, including examinations. Registration questions should be directed to Dr. Kion, tkion@mail.ubc.ca.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Priority for students in Microbiology & Immunology specializations.  The mode of delivery for this section is in-person.  In person attendance is required for all course activities, including examinations.  Registration questions should be directed to Dr. Kion, tkion@mail.ubc.ca. This course is credit excluded with PATH 437.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: The mode of delivery for this section is in-person.  In person attendance is required for all course activities, including examinations. Registration questions should be directed to Dr. Kion, tkion@mail.ubc.ca.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: Students will need to have a faculty mentor from the Department of Microbiology & Immunology before registration into MICB 448A.  See the following URL for faculty that may have seats open in their laboratories.  https://www.microbiology.ubc.ca/faculty-staff/faculty. After you have a faculty mentor agree to have you work in their lab, contact Dr. Kion at tkion@mail.ubc.ca for registration into the course.  Include your student number and the name of your faculty mentor.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: For students in the Honour specializations only.  Students will need to have a faculty mentor from the Department of Microbiology & Immunology before registration into MICB 449.  See the following URL for faculty that may have seats open in their laboratories.  https://www.microbiology.ubc.ca/faculty-staff/faculty. After you have a faculty mentor agree to have you work in their lab, contact Dr. Kion at tkion@mail.ubc.ca for registration into the course.  Include your student number and the name of your faculty mentor.

instances.text: MICB_V 471-101 - Laboratory Research in Microbiology and Immunology

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: This course replaces MICB 421 and MICB 447 effective 2022W.  MICB  471 is credit-excluded with MICB 421 and MICB 447.  Registration questions should be directed to Dr. Oliver, dcoliver@mail.ubc.ca.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: This course replaces MICB 401 effective 2022W.  MICB  475 is credit-excluded with MICB 401.  Registration questions should be directed to Dr. Kion, tkion@mail.ubc.ca. In addition to lectures students will be required to attend a weekly 45 minute meeting (scheduled during the first two weeks of classes).

uiLabels.WDRES.FACETEDSEARCH.SymanSyntax:
Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
